result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Pace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders DV surcharge.
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, Court does not order costs as the defendant has provided a sample.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, Court costs and surcharges.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
DOC to collect monetary amounts at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided  in Sec. 973.05(40(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any amounts that remain unpaid when defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount that remains  unpaid when sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can proceed under Sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

*5/9/2016  Honorable Thomas McAdams-Order signed.  The confinement term on counts one and two, both counts,  are commuted to one year and six months
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain employment or be enrolled in school.

No Contact Order with A.D. remains.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

Underg drug treatment and a mental health evaluation.  Court rejects probation recommendation.
Court does not order  sex offender registration, but the defendant must complete a sex offender evaluation.

superTimeConds.notes: DOC should consider placing the defendant.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, Court does not order costs as the defendant has provided a sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J Pace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Commuting Probation Term. Confinement on counts 1 and 2 are communted to 1 year and 6 months.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of excessive sentence (initial confinement time).

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS .  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant to maintain employment or be enrolled in school.
NO CONTACT ORDER WTH  A.D. REMAINS.
Defendant to undergo drug treatment and a mental health evaluation. Court rejections probation recommendation.
Defendant to complete 100 hours of community service.
DOC should consider placing the defendant on the Fathers Initative Program.
Court does not order sex offender registration but the defendant must complete a sex offender evaluation.
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Court orders DV surcharge
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank (court does not order costs as the defendant has provided a sample).
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts 3-5 dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNTS 1-2  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. PSI was ordered without a recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Agreed Facts for Purposes of Plea and Sentencing.
Court vacates jury trial.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine, Defendant's Theory of Defense Jury Instructions and Defendant's Supplemental Jury Instructions.

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Antoni Apollo appeared for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wishes to set this case for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ADA Williams informed the court that this case will not proceed to sentencing on the next court date as victim notification needs to be made.
received and filed from Attorney Singleton.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reconsider the Circuit Court's Denial of Defendant's Request for a Second Preliminary Hearing Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 906.12 received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reconsider Court's Denial of Franks-Mann Challenges to the Complaint and the Preliminary Hearing received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Order signed and filed. The Court hereby DENIES the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss based upon the Criminal Complaint and Prejudicial Bindover, based upon Franks-Mann violations. Copy of the order sent to ADA Williams and attorney Singleton. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Arguments heard as to defense motion to dismiss the complaint. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Defense counsel will be filing a motion to reconsider. Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates be set.   Parties to file motions (including motion to reconsider) by 7/27/15. State's response due by 8/03/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date.   Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. State placed offer on the record, which defense counsel acknowledged receipt of. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am. Jury Trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.
Response to State's Reply Brief to Defendant's Franks Motion received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Response to the Defense Motion to Dismiss Complaint received and filed.  ADA Williams will file an amended pleading with a corrected case number.

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Arguments heard as to defense motion to reconsider denial of defendant's motion for adjournment of the preliminary hearing. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Discussion regarding defense counsel's Franks motion. Due to the lateness of the filings, Court ordered this matter adjourned for a motion hearing. State's response due on or before 7/13/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defense's Franks-Mann Version of Truthful Complaint with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense's Franks-Mann Brief Regarding False Statements at the Preliminary Hearing received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing  MAY 20, 2015 received and filed. (31 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY JUSTIN SINGLETON, P.O. BOX 527, WAUKESHA, WI 53187, PUBLIC DEFENDER APPOINTMENT. kl

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to the defense counsel's motions filed with the Court. Court denied defense motion to reconsider denial of defendant's motion for adjournment. Court ordered the arraignment adjourned and time limits waived for reasons stated on the record. Court ordered the State to file any response by 06/18/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of motion and motion to reconsider denial of defendant's motion for adjournment of the preliminary hearing, pursuant to Elam v. State, 50 WIS 2D 383 received and filed.

Notice of motion and Franks motion objecting to both the complaint and prejudicial bindover, both based on the intentionally or recklessly false statements and the State's failure to include relevant evidence received and filed.
Notice of motion and motion to reconsider denial of Defendant's motion for adjournment of the preliminary hearing, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 906.12 received and filed.

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Erin Karshen for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense motion for an adjournment is reviewed and denied by the Court.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jeritt Mees-West Allis Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense Counsel is requesting an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amanda D. or her child, GRD/family/home/work/school

Defendant Eric J Pace in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Eric J Pace in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
